title: Gosford Forest Park Walking Route

images.title: P Flannagan / Farmland at Tannaghmore Road, Markethill
images.caption: Farmland at Tannaghmore Road, Markethill

description: Follow the waymarked trails through this large park near the village of Markethill in County Armagh. It's a great place for walking with miles of woodland trails, streams, waterfalls, ponds, grassland and a lovely arboretum to visit. Features of the park include an area of open parkland with deer and rare breeds. There is also a lovely Arboretum with attractive conifer and broadleaf trees with a pretty walled garden. There are several colour coded walking trails to try and also a cycling trail. These are of varying lengths and difficulty and take you to the impressive 19th century Gosford Castle, the Drumlack River and Draper's Hill. See the maps below for details of the trails.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking around County Armagh you could head to Slieve Gullion, the highest point in the county. There are wonderful far reaching views to enjoy from this elevated spot in the Ring of Gullion AONB. There's also Peatlands Park where there's several colour coded walks taking you around the 680 acre site. The park consists of peatlands, orchards, woodland, boardwalks and two nature reserves. For more walking ideas in the area see the Northern Ireland Walks page.

display_address: Markethill Road, Markethill, County Armagh, Northern Ireland / Tuaisceart Éireann, BT60 1PH, United Kingdom
